intro: Erodium laciniatum var. cavanillesii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, pink to purple flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are finely divided and often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides.
